review: I had the worst experience of my life this morning. I was given this horrendous drug yesterday and took one last night. I woke this morning and literally couldn't breath. Couldn't even talk. Had to rush to A@E. Oxygen levels were low had to have an ECG and was put on a nebuliser. Omg this drug is going to kill someone. Please be careful. Scared me to death and still wheezy.
Concerned about side effects of Omeprozole long term so switched to Pepcid AC20mg - 2X daily with good results.

Please do not take this drug. My son was on Ranitidine for years with no side effects but when they took it off the market- they prescribed Famotidine. Right away I noticed me son was not sleeping at night, it was like he was wired for days. He was up and irritable and moaning a lot and at night he would wake up throwing up so bad and would have trouble breathing. After this happening for a few nights I realized it was probably the medication so I stopped giving him it and by the second night he finally was sleeping through the night without waking up throwing up. He also has had several dilation of his throat and when he was on famotidine he developed lumps in his throat and I told his Gastrointestinal doctor I think it is from the famotidine and he said probably not. So the next dilation was 3 months later and I was not giving him the famotidine and guess what the lumps miraculously disappeared. He also is diabetic and it was affecting his insulin.
I noticed after taking this that I feel like I can't swallow. I get heart palpitation, dizziness and shortness of breath. I will not be taking this anymore.

I have been having reflux problems for 2 years. After gallbladder removal my GP started me on Famitodine!! My problem was getting worse but never thought it could be this drug, then I came across this site and all the patients that had been taking it , and I absolutely agree with you all this drug is awful!! Side effects of headaches, fatigue, constipation, depression and muscle spasm cramps. So to all of you that have suffered with this poisoning drug NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN. It is my first day stopping them so probably in for a rough ride not that I care as long as these get out my system they WANT BANNING!!!!!!

Diagnosed with GERD a few years ago. Also mild gastritis after gastroscopy. Started with Omeprazole but switched to Lansoprazole due to side effects. I have had a few flare ups in the past but recently got a bad one. GP gave me Famotidine 2xD. Within hours of taking the first dose (20mg), I started to feel sore in lower back. After the second dose, I was having sharp intermittent (every 1-5 minutes, lasting just seconds) sharp pains in my mid back. Maybe it is a coincidence but reading the comments here, it sounds like side effects can be quick to appear. Anyway, I have stopped taking it. It's been about 30 hours since the last dose but I still have the sharp pains. Anxiously waiting to see if the effect will subside or if it is something else to worry about.

My first night on it last night and I'm not sure. I woke up midnight with SEVERE PANIC ATTACK. I mean out of no where. Some numbness but that could be covid or anxieties. I don't like to jump to conclusions but my acid reflux burns now in my chest after I took the medication. I don't think I'll continue these meds. I had an acid attack after taking advil so I just hope the docs know what they say and are doing.

After about a week on famotidine I didn't really notice where it was helping me with the heartburn that I had. I had to supplement the famotidine with over-the-counter antacids like Pepto-Bismol or a bicarbonate tablet. But I would say about five or six days into taking famotidine I start to have palpitations and feelings of discomfort in my chest and then with that came on feelings of anxiety and other symptoms like my muscles hurting sides and my back hurting feeling like my kidneys are hurting just all. I started to have slight headaches for no reason and I drink a lot of water per day. I do not recommend H2 blockers and PPI's because just tweaking your diet can actually help your digestive tract a lot better than swallowing this garbage that actually damages your stomach and your intestines in the long run. I would not recommend famotidine to take longer than a week and I have noticed in some of these reviews people have been on this medicine for a year-wow, I can't do it!

Stay away from this drug and let me tell you about my experience.  I’ve suffered from acid reflux for a number of years. I went to a doctor and was prescribed this medication once daily. I was on it for roughly two years and never felt worse. Although it did help with my GERD, it ruined me in other ways. I had insomnia, anxiety, weight loss, etc. I could not put my finger on why I felt so lousy until I started to narrow down what could be going on. I then realized that the only medication that I was on was Famotidine so I decided to do my homework. After reading other horror story reviews about this drug, I decided to stop taking it and see if this was the cause of why I felt so crappy. Sure enough, it was the root cause. Shortly after going off of the Famotidine my anxiety was gone, I was sleeping soundly again and I have put on 10lbs in just two months. I have now been off of the Famotidine for six months and I’ve never felt better.

Worst pills ever. They don't relieve my acid reflux and they keep me up all night. It's like I'm on speed when I take them. I can't sit still and clean my house like a maniac when I'm on them. The crash the next morning is horrible and my entire body aches. Switching back to Omeprazole. This stuff is garbage!

Took famotidine 20 mg/day for a few weeks back in September 2020. Had the worst side effects: Shooting pains in head, racing heart, chest pains, head pressure, burning skin on my arms, muscle spasms on my stomach and collar bone, stiff neck, stiff lower back, stomach issues, GI issues, fatigue. I had the worst feeling of anxiety coming from my stomach. I never knew what anxiety was until I had this experience. I never had problems sleeping before this. It felt like I was poisoned.  Took me a week to realize it was the famotidine. I stopped it immediately. Some of the side effects gradually went away. I took magnesium and started b12 supplementation. Took zantac for years and never had any issues. Many people I spoke with said their side effects went away after 3-4 months. However, I am still dealing with many side effects a year later. If there is anyone who has any insight into this/recommend a doctor who has helped them through this I would greatly appreciate any help.

2/3 of users here, rate ranitidine very poor, most  rarely 1 of 10  in effectiveness for GERD. I have 95% worst acid generation according to my Gastero  Dr. , using acid meter down my throat. I get near zero help from this drug, do not understand,  why anybody thinks it replaced ranitidine. Rate 0.

I started taking it and didn’t have any problems for the first two days I have a really bad sleeping schedule and I didn’t any no sleep the third day and went to run some errands.  My  chest was really tight head felt kind of funky and then felt real bloated unfortunately I also have an enlarged liver due to gallbladder stones I don’t know if it’s from the medicine or if it’s because of what’s going on with me but I stopped taking it and will find an alternative

I've been on famotidine for about 3 months & was advised by my doctor to taper down and stop taking omeprazole for GERD symptoms. Famotidine does absolutely nothing, though, and while I can get by with only taking omeprazole every other day, if I try to go any longer than that without taking omeprazole, the reflux symptoms kick back in worse than they were before. We're talking, "gets heartburn even from milk" without the omeprazole.I'm sure famotidine works for some folks, but it does nothing to ease my symptoms.

Doctor prescribed this medication to me for my acid reflux burning sensation in my stomach, 2 days into this medication I started to feel bloated, no appetite, burping for no reason, can’t even use the restroom, urine is dark, dry mouth, headaches and back pain. I am more worried about all the side effects then I was with my stomach burning. Now I am trying to call a doctor to check how long does this pill leave your system. Never taking this medication. Home remedies is the best.

Took it for COVID nausea/GERD and felt super drowsy 30 min. after taking it. Then anxious and paranoid for the rest of the night. My stomach was super bloated with tons of gas and pains more than without it. I've had diarrhea this morning, cried, and had a heart palp. My son took some last night as well and burped so much. Even though the half-life says 2-3 hours, I definitely believe that the side effects last longer. Drinking lots of water to get this crap out of my system. This stuff should be discontinued. Our Pedi even said there was no side effects with this.... everything has a side effect. Was $20 too.

Took Pepcid max strength for two months due to really bad heartburn and inflammation of the stomach. I want to tell people this is the worst medication. I’ve been through 8 months of sheer hell after stopping and am still recovering. I’ve had to be put on mood stabilizers. Didn’t sleep for nearly a week straight, anxiety, derealization, intrusive thoughts and impending doom with panic. Please don’t ever take this medication it is pure awfulness in a  pill.

took my first one yesterday, but by evening I was very hot, nauseous and weak. Woke up this morning not any better. Will not take any more famotidine. I will go back to Pantaprozole, at least I did not have any side effects from Pantaprozole.

Been struggling with GERD for a while, got prescribed famotidine at 20mg per pill. If anything, I’d rather just battle my GERD symptoms without it. Makes me feel extremely nauseous, stomach is constantly churning and making me feel like I need to vomit. If I could give it a 0/10 I would. This stuff is pure garbage

First off let me say this medication is not for everyone. It's has helped me tremendously so far but my GERD is so bad that I'm puking from it and it feels like I'm having a heart attack whenever it's happening. The only side affect that I've had from taking the medication is feeling too full whenever I eat something. This is the 2nd day that I've taken it. Other then that I've been ok. Will do another update a couple of days later.

I waited until the evening to take this the first time. I already take Rabeprazole which hadn’t been effective lately so my GP told me to take 20mg alongside my regular medication. After taking this, I began to feel sick within the first hour which progressively got worse during the night - I didn’t actually vomit but it felt close. I got pains in my chest, a strange sensation in my throat, headache and terrible anxiety. It also didn’t stop the heartburn discomfort. Didn’t sleep much. The following day, my anxiety was still bad, heartburn was awful to the point I only managed to eat two slices of toast the entire day and the throat feeling wouldn’t go away (like something was stuck in my throat). I also got strange chest pains like my heart was skipping or something. I had had a few ok days prior to taking this medication and feel like I have ruined any progress I was making. The anxiety that this is causing is ridiculous. I would tell anyone never to touch this stuff.

Took it for four days for acid reflux which it fixed. Suddenly felt high anxiety, palpitations, and insomnia on the fourth day. I stopped taking it and my normal sleep schedule returned at first. Now I'm experiencing insomnia and palpitations the day after I exercise. It's been almost two weeks since I stopped. I'm hoping this goes away soon. It's misery and I'll never take this drug again.
Took for 3 days, ended up in the hospital after a panic attack in the middle of the night. Awful change to mood, emotional state, muscle tremors…stay away

Was put on omeprazole while in hospital, after 6 month I developed constant nausea and sickness, after speaking with my own local doctor she told me to stop taken them and start famotidine 20mg twice per day, stopped omeprazole on the Friday and started famotidine Saturday, one tablet and within 3 hours the nausea / sickness was gone, couldn’t believe it, only side affects I've had with famotidine is a mild sore head which clears after 10 min roughly, other slight niggle is stomach and abdomen area rumbles and growling loudly later on at nights, really can not fault this drug. Being honest if you get prescribed this try it  it has helped me wonders, but time will tell only been on it 2 weeks, looks promising for sure

WE took another drug for GERD which was pulled off the market.  We switched (two of us) to Famotidine but a generic, we were both within two days back to acid, nausea, and no relief.We then found the TEVA version and within  two days of starting back on that, no symptoms, at all.   I have to drive an hour to pick up the TEVA as no one near me carries it.  It is 1/2 of the price of the other generic with my insurance and that helps pay for the gas.  I went to an independent drug store to find this. Cannot say enough good things about the way this works.  We take it with breakfast and dinner, 40 mg.

OK. So I’ve used this over 2 periods I’d different ways. Originally, I was prescribed one tablet at night. This was effective, but by the day the acid reflux was back. It’s not listed on drug interactions, but it appears it react with anything over 25mg of pregabalin. I gave up and suffered for a few more months.A few weeks ago I decided to give it another go, starting with one tablet a day, also reducing Pregabalin. This time things were better. It was deeply unpleasant for 2 weeks, but went down to quite unpleasant as I got used to it. At this point I went up to 2 tablets a day, which caused stomach cramps for 3 days. After that, it’s been fine. I’m now used to Famotidine and I feel much better with the GERD. It’s not a perfect solution, you have to be prepared for your body rebelling against it, but 2 weeks of pain for ongoing relief is a trade off I think is worth it.

ppi gave me panic attacks all of them so I took this pathetic medicine famotidine for almost 2 months Daily. Initially I felt bloated, burping 24×7 ; burning in lower abdomen & very foul smelling flatus.  I never had constipation but after starting famotidine I was badly constipated then it affected my mind gradually anxiety kicked in ; insomnia with twitching of thigh muscles ;I  was anxious 24×7 with depressive & suicidal thoughts as if life is all sad & dark panic attacks as if I am having a heart attack & its all over. One day I skipped this med & that day I felt better and realised it was Famotidine ! So I stopped it & realised that my insomnia got better & my twitching of muscles stopped anxiety gradually lowered...my personal experience both ppi & famotidine sucks

Took this medicine for GERD,   after 1 week I started getting anxiety attacks, heart palpitations, and muscle weakness, dizziness, and nausea. I felt bloated all the time and I couldn’t eat. When the insomnia symptoms escalated like I’d drank a pot of coffee, it was intensely scary. Even 24 hours after my last dose, I still don’t feel well. I wouldn’t recommend to anyone.

I haven’t slept in 2 days due to my 7 week old hitting the 1 week mark with this medication in her system. I truly felt like she was going to die. I couldn’t figure it out.. I would have never thought in a million years it was this until all of the symptoms match with hers and I give her CLEAN breastmilk. I stopped the medicine immediately and the next day I had a whole new baby. She couldn’t sleep longer than 20 min at a time. Intense rubbing of her mouth so I thought she was getting a tooth or something! Crying like I’ve never heard before. Absolutely terrifying. She stopped smiling the last couple days she was on it. Today she’s back to her smiley self. Oh and she’s insanely constipated. Now you know! Stay away.
Made me unwell at just 20mg before bed - anxiety, raised bp, dizziness, migraine lasting days, near constant gas and gastrointestinal upset. If you take this look out for unexplained migraines.

Had to call 111.  Had terrible anxiety, panic attacks etc. Felt worse than I have ever felt in my life. Felt like I was dying. My head was all over the place, had no energy, couldn't concentrate. My doctor gave me Diazepam to help with panic attacks. I came off the Famatidine and after 3 days of torture I am starting to feel a little better. This medication should be withdrawn as soon as possible to stop anyone else going through the same drama!

Thank you for all that have posted your experience with this drug.  If there is any bad side effects to medications I will have them, so I read all of these before deciding to take this. I just threw my bottle in the garbage that was prescribed by my Gastro Dr, after reading these HORROR stories.  It is so frustrating that these conventional medicine doctors just want to give you a band aid to try and cover up your symptoms (that rarely ever work) instead of getting to the root cause and healing your body. I suppose they are just not trained in this.   I am now going the functional medicine route for my digestive issues and will never go back to them after 10 years of no resolve.  Unfortunately most insurances do not cover this. Hope my posting helps others as well!

I was prescribed famotidine to help with my GERD and excess acid.  First day was fine but the next day was horrible.  I had anxiety, cough, muscle spasms in my legs and foot and my blood pressure went through the roof.  It shot up to 188/108!  I stopped taking it and will go back to Protonix until I can see my GI doc.Really disappointing because it did help my GERD
Once I started this medicine I haven't had anymore acid reflux

My daughter got some strong GERD all day long couldn’t even sleep so her dr prescribed famotidine twice a day and it helped, it is just she is like a zombie now, she’s too calm and isn’t herself at all, has to think well when you ask a question and go over it many times asking her again til she answers.They said this medicine is being used for mental health because of the histamine being blocked. Schizophrenics have high histamine.  So I guess it does work for that. Says is being used for schizophrenia, also she gets very bad headache, don’t know if will go away.

When I initially was told to start on this by my doctor, I got really bad stomach aches and it didn't help my reflux. I developed horrible burping and my doctor told me to just take it twice a day instead of once. That didn't help so I stopped taking it. Burping never went away. Started taking it again recently because my reflux was acting up and I was desperate for relief. Sharp chest pains radiating to my back, severe shortness of breath (I get some with GERD but this is next level). I'm never taking this again

Pepcid has made my GERD symptoms way way worse after taking it I feel under my left rib this pain that gets worse as you breathe in!! I’ve taken it at 11:30pm and it is now 3am and I’m still up!!! And still feeling a little bit of the pain. Will never ever ever ever take this stuff again this is the worse drug you can take and I suggest going the natural route. I only took it because I was having a little heartburn from something I ate for dinner but I wish I didn’t take it and just dealt with the heartburn because it would’ve been 100x easier than this.

I have been taking Famotidine for 2 weeks now as a subsitute for Cimetidine which out of supply at the moment.  This med is really good for the interstitial cystitis in my bladder and doubles up to reduce GERD too.   Taking 2mg twice per day.   No other side effects.
Worst experience

I have laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR) symptoms and this drug truly helps all the symptoms every time I take it which is why I’m a bit disappointed that I don’t plan to take it anymore. The side effects it does to me are horrible, it’s honestly worse than the reflux itself! I get extreme anxiety, rapid heart-rate, and the cherry on top, muscle spasms. I have night time reflux so I used to take these at night, and one night I took one and I couldn’t sleep all night. I got anxiety from it + I would have these muscle spasms that felt like earthquakes. 10/10 for relieving acid-reflux symptoms, 0/10 for its side effects. It could be different for everyone so if you got no side effects, bravo. But look out for those extreme side effects because I felt like I was going to die due to the anxiety + muscle spasms it gave me.

I stared taking this medication 3 days ago and I’ve had really bad side effects. I’ve had diarrhea, headaches, anxiety right after I take it, and joint pain especially on my arm and my back. My dr said I had to continue taking this medication as it has been helping with my stomach acid but it takes me a while to not feel the side effects of this medication.

I've been taking this for IDK how long. Probably since ranitidine has been taken off the shelves. But I've been clean off meth for almost 4 YEARS.! Went and did a drug test for a possible new job  only to test positive for meth and thats the only thing I've been taking. Thankfully was told oral drug tests aren't very accurate so had to do a urine test instead. But will not be taking Famotidine any longer. It didn't even help my acid reflux. Kept taking it because I thought it was from the stuff I've been eating
Using 40mg twice daily for severe GERD symptoms for over 18 months. Excellent drug with stellar symptom control without any side-effects.

I was on 40mg twice a day for 2 weeks. Side effects, day 5 my skin was hot and felt like I got hives, this lasted for a few days and I reduced the amount to 20mg in the morning and 40mg in the evening. Which helped the issue and went away from day 10. Sometimes I get a headache and slight pain around the eyes. Apart from that no side effects. I read it lasts around 12 hours in my body. I found 20mg lasts around 10 hours and 40mg lasts around 14 hours in my body. I made sure to space the dosage out between 12 hour periods. Also drank lots of water, the medicine comes out of your body through your kidneys. I read people with kidney issues might have problems with this medicine. For me this medicine worked ok. I had problems with 40mg on omeprazole and lansoprazole, it gave me pins and needles in my fingers and pain in my wrists that went on for 6 months after stopping that medicine, whereas famotidine gave me no problem in my hands.
Shortly after starting to take famotidine I developed a cough and looked up side effects and cough was a rare side effect so I stopped taking it and within a day my cough began to go away.
I will never take famotidine again. I felt absolutely horrible! Made me super dizzy and anxious and insanely tired I was only taking the 20mg dose.

So this drug is the worst! I DO NOT recommend it. The second I take it I notice issues swallowing, excessive mucous, and difficulty breathing to the point that I’ve been to the ER twice! I’m just glad I noticed it was from this as doctors do not realise  over the counter drug can cause severe side effects. Other fun side effects listed under rare that I had are: chills, anxiety, trouble sleeping, hallucinations, irritability, restlessness, dizziness, weakness. This SHOULD BE TAKEN OFF THE MARKET ESPECIALLY AS AN OVER THE COUNTER DRUG.
Helps my GERD and acid reflux so much, I don't know what I would do without it

I have silent acid reflux meaning hardly ever heartburn but occasionally I do vomit into my throat. Nasty feeling!! My throat and tongue burn most of the time. DOES ANYONE ELSE HAVE THIS??? It's ruining my life. I've been using Famotidine about a month at night only with very insignificant help from it. Help! I've tried Protonix-- horrible side effects. I take an anxiety now due to the anxious feelings of pain and something stuck in my throat. Had endoscopy, got treated for gastritis etc.
worked for reflux but gave me horrible nausea and feeling like throwing up an hour after I took it

I had to take Famotidine as no Ranitidine is available. Famotidine is a horrible drug, pains in rib cage, back horrific. I have now stopped and am looking for alternatives, I would never take this again.

I have possible GERD, definite excessive acid in stomach and I am furious that my GI dr prescribed this famotidine, considering most of the side effects are what I'm taking protonix for. I took two tablets within three days of each other. The first one made me almost instantly nauseous and constipated, along with excessive fatigue, feeling like I have the flu, and acid reflux. I tried it one more time two days ago and I have abdominal pain so bad I spend most of the day in bed crying. It can also elevate liver enzymes, I have MCAS and mine are already elevated. I feel like it is really damaging me and I'm going to the ER tomorrow because I don't know what else to do. This is the worst drug I have ever experienced.

My doctor switched me to famotidine 6 weeks ago. Since that time I have had a cough, shortness of breath and uncontrollable itching. I made an appointment with my PC because of the symptoms experiencing. Afterward I started to think back to changes made within the last 6 weeks and remembered starting a new reflux meds. While researching famotidine side effects, all of the current systems were listed. Worst of all hives was a symptom. Will stop taking immediately.

This famotidine is the worse medication I have ever taken. I feel so much worse taking this medication than not. Headaches, chest tightening and anxiety I have never experienced. I will never use this stuff ever again. The side effects are too much to bear. I felt so alone before I read the other reviews.

I have been on omeprazole for about a year and prior to that, pantoprozale  because of ibuprofen therapy which caused stomach problems. Doctor said a  PPI is necessary.  Well, recently the side effects increased on omeprazole and I encountered trapped gas throughout my ribs, intestine and bowels with excruciating pain. Omeprazole lists c diff as a side effect with sepsis and this had me scared. I got off it and am taking the famotidine before bed, 40mg. After one night, I slept with my ongoing meditation and woke up fantastic. The real test was eating, readjusted my food intake to smaller bites. Went all day with very little pain, slight bowel/stomach gurgling and passing the trapped gas. The famotidine allowed the muscles to relax enough for a proper movement. Took with food, saltine crackers and 6oz glass of water. It did make me sleepy but not overbearing. If pantoprozale and omeprazole aren't effective, I recommend famotidine because it works differently.

Took one chewable tablet of Pepcid Complete for my GERD.  It helped with the stomach acid but about two hours later I had strong intestinal cramping and diarrhea, which thankfully lasted only about a half hour afterward.

I was prescribed 20mg Famotidine for GERDS symptoms *dry cough & acid reflux * two times a day. Initially it was very helpful with the cough but I still had the reflux & it seemed to make me have to burp often. In addition, I have tightness in my chest now.  I just completed my 3rd week on it & I have random sadness with some suicidal thoughts occurring. I have never had suicidal thoughts ever in my life! I researched side effects & apparently that is a rare one. I'm discontinuing use of the drug & looking into natural remedies.

Gerd - over acidic stomach, did not have acid reflux.  I've been taking Pepcid AC for years with good results.  Acid issue was becoming worse, Dr. prescribed 40 mg Famotidine, 1 x day.  At first it helped along with changing to a bland, non-fatty food diet (I lost 25 lbs, hoping to lose another 10).  Advised Dr. of waning relief, he increased dosage to 2 x day.  I experienced worse effects, acidic stomach along with diarrhea, bloating/gas if I ate/cheated on diet, (1 whole egg instead of just the whites).  Same reaction to other spicey or fatty foods in small quantities, not whole meals.  Went back to 1 x day for a week, then I stopped taking the medication for one day and felt better, no excessive acid after eating 6 oz of steak.  Previously under the med, a hamburger caused the worsened symptoms.  Will stay off the med and continue with diet and limited intake of fatty & spicey foods.  Will drop the med if things continue to improve without it.

Yesterday was my first time taking it since I have stomach soreness from food poisoning last week. Right after taking it, I was coughing felt nauseous and it felt like my chest was tightening but it only lasted an hour. I felt tired and had a migraine most of the day. Today, I got the same symptoms of the coughing, Nausea and chest tightness. I am going to call my doctor tomorrow and see what else I can take.

famotidine is awesome! I would highly recommend it. I have been using it for more than a year and recently I stopped it for 2 weeks and felt awful but not any worse than when I wasn't taking it several years ago.  After restarting it I immediately felt better. It helps my GERD, heartburn, and I can breathe better (probably due to it being an H2 antihistamine) and it helps my anxiety. Overall, I would highly recommend it.

Just began taking Famotidine for the first time as omeprazole made me sick. So on this I notice I feel bloated after 12 hours of taking it even though at first it got rid of my acid reflux within like 15 mins. However I woke up almost in a panic feeling like I was gonna have a heart attack, I was burping excessively to the point my stomach feels in knots, I can't sleep a full 8 hours. I wake up like every 2 hours or can't even go back to sleep at all and I work night shift. I even feel like my muscles wanna just spasm out of control. And I feel like my heart beat is irregular right now too, it's crazy to think a drug can do this. Much like someone else said here I'd rather have the acid reflux as this is torture; who would ever make a drug like this. What ever happened to safety, this stuff is not safe, but DR. has determined this will do more good then cause you harm. THAT'S A LIE. Done with these trash pharmaceuticals companies drugs I'm gonna try natural remedies.

I had gotten over a cold and my lungs felt clogged. I had described the problem to my doctor on a virtual visit because it had been going on for 3 weeks.  I had started taking allergy medicine a few days before, and my condition started clearing up, but wanted to check with my doctor either way.  He said it was reflux and prescribed Famotidine to me. I had never had stomach problems before this. 1 took it for 10 days, and within a week, my stomach was twisted in knots and I got heartburn.  The medicine seemed to create the problem that it was meant to stop. My lungs eventually cleared up, but I am left with reflux. Don’t take it.

First off let me just say this amotidine  works for GERD, anyone who has GERD symptoms I took this for 5 days and it simmered down so much I barely have symptoms now. But I have anxiety and muscle twitching and I think muscle twitching is a reported side effect of this as well as waking you up as you fall asleep is another serious symptom this causes.  To me it works but isn't worth the trouble.

Pepcid (famotidine):I got so stressed with this Covid stuff and when very stressed I succumb to overeating, eating and spitting, it went on for a week and oh my gosh after a week the heartburn was crippling.  One pepcid pill quieted things down. It been 1 hour and all is still in there thank goodness.

Finally realized this med famotidine was causing me to wake up immediately after falling asleep, with my heart racing, caused extreme insomnia which I have never had at all. It did help reflux but I will never take it again.

Took this medicine for GERD, After 1 week I started getting constipation, anxiety, heart palpitations, and muscle weakness, dizziness, and nausea. I felt bloated all the time and I couldn’t eat. I wouldn’t recommend to anyone.

I rather just have the heartburn than take famotidine. Half the side effects this med can cause that you see on this site, I got them! This medication made me weak, caused me muscle pain, gave me headaches and worsened my anxiety. My doctor is very good, but I'm disappointed he gave me this. I'll stick to Tums or something. Famo is a mess. Does more harm than good.

Pepcid (famotidine):I had been taking Ranitidine (300mg twice a day), but after that was recalled, I tried Pepcid Complete. It seemed to work for a month or so, taking one in the morning, and one in the evening. But then the acid reflux continued to be a problem so I am here looking at others drug reviews. On the Pepcid website it states: PEPCID® products are not indicated for the treatment of GERD.I am going to try my luck with Prilosec OTC, based on the reviews that gets on this site.

My doctor just switched me over to Famotidine.  I don't like the way it makes me feel. I've noticed muscle cramps and a tightening in my throat. I was on Ranitidine but due to the recall my doctor took me off of it. I had no bad effects from the ranitidine and I'm going to see if I can get back on it. Nothing really helps me all my issues are still here but at least I didn't have any bad side effects. I don't know what the answer is
I have started taking this and I have no appetite and have loss of energy and nausea. What else can I do?
In my experience, famotidine is helpful for my GERD. Stops the acidic feeling and the slight nausea  quickly
I take it before bed. It does a great job and, I just found out, it is the longest lasting H2 Antagonist out of the 3 others.

Awful! Took this med for 5-6 weeks, explosive diarrhea and unable to control urinating. My throat often closed up when I tried to eat. Had to sleep sitting up; other wise I was awaken by insistent coughing, unable to get my breath several times each night. Dr didn’t believe this was the reason for all my symptoms till I took it information from Rx side effects.

My doctor first suggested pantoprazole for my acid reflux, which I’ve used in the past. But I wanted to try something a little more gentle this time. I was pleasantly surprised that this worked perfectly. I started with the maximum dose for a few weeks, then slowly weaned off it completely over a few months.

It doesn't do a darn thing for me. I don't even know why I bother taking it. I have to sleep sitting up so that I don't throw up all night from GERD. I have tried all of the major drugs to try to control my condition, but none of them work. Very discouraging. The only thing that seems to help even a little bit is keeping my stomach full at all times (at least when I throw up, it's not bile or acid). I've gained almost 60 pounds this last year as a result of it, though.
Since taking this I have had extreme anxiety, difficulty sleeping  and unable to eat. Has anyone this problem?
Pepcid (famotidine):Been on this medication 15 days; noticed after 7 days a drop in sexual performance; after 14 days a complete inability to get an erection.

I have GERD, and Irritable Bowel Syndrome. For my GERD, it is cheaper to buy OTC medicines rather than prescription version. I take famotidine 10mg tablets twice day before meals.  I take this along with 200mg Cimetidine. For the cimetidine I take 2 tablets twice a day. This therapy works great for me and my doctor is glad I finally found a relief.
Pepcid (famotidine):I took Pepcid and Pepcid AC for years but like all Gas pills One pill could make me my stools solid "constipation" like for a couple of days.

So far, famotidine is working great for my chronic GERD, acid reflux. I also made life changing eating habits and added even more exercise to my routine but I still have this condition. Also, need to eat more frequently every 2-3 hours, small snacks and meals really helps. I usually take one of these when I feel it coming on, usually in between meals and it quickly calms it. I only take one a day and then if I feel it at night after dinner or right before bed I take 150mg Zantac (ranitidine). I try to limit to only ONE 20mg famotidine and ONE 150mg Zantac a day. Seems to work quite well. Too much of any PPI or H2 blockers and you can reverse the process of what you're trying to achieve. I only take a couple Tums when in desperate need.
Works better than others for me.  Also, no interaction with Tylenol.

I used to take famotidine 20mg 2 x daily and it did the job.  Now I need it every 5 to 6 hrs for relief.  So I decided to use Pepto-bismal yesterday morning at 8 and it worked very well and lasted until about 9pm. Then I took a Pepcid that night, but it doesn't work for me like it use to.

I was a huge Tums eater with little success. At night while lying down I'd have the acid come up all the way to my nose - quite a burning, nasty sensation. It would appear that this little 20 mg pill makes ALL the difference. I take it about an hour before my evening meal. So far it has performed incredibly well - I've not had any GERD (acid reflux) even after a 4 taco with heavy onion and salsa dinner plus 3 beers.
Pepcid AC Chewable Tablets (famotidine):After using Protonix for years I am finding that one chewable Pepcid in the morning and another at night is working great!
